intro: Pavetta whiteana, commonly known as the white pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant typically features opposite, ovate leaves with smooth margins and produces small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Pavetta whiteana is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream banks.
